nodes.bodyText: An option should be exposed to change the output path from something other than ./src.
I dont think thats needed, adds added compliexity for something that I dont think has a lot of gain.

If there's already an existing src, this is what users will have to use without an option:
mv src tempSrc
./gradlew decompileCFR
mv src minecraftSrc
mv tempSrc src
Shouldn't this be minecraftSrc or similar to be in line with remappedSrc, and in certain scenarios, not overwrite an existing src folder?

there isnt an existing src, I did kinda think of dumping it in src/main/java and making it importable into an ide so you could explore the code a bit easier but thats prob not needed.
I think what we have here is fine? What do others think?
on 2nd throughts, remappedSrc does make more sense. I will change this
Another solution would be to potentially halt the process if src already exists.
changed to namedSrc to follow the jar.
